text:
FOP has a -mif output option.  FOP can transform to a PDF file with the 
following style sheet.  However, FOP prints a traceback if
the -mif output option is used.  


<fo:table>
<fo:table-column column-width="150pt"/>
<fo:table-column column-width="150pt"/>
<fo:table-body font-size="10pt" font-family="sans-serif">
<fo:table-row>
<fo:table-cell>
<fo:block>text</fo:block>
</fo:table-cell>
<fo:table-cell>
<fo:block>text</fo:block>
</fo:table-cell>
</fo:table-row>
</fo:table-body>
</fo:table>
creator: morriswr@westinghouse.com
j3322ptm@yahoo.de
text:
The MIF renderer (in 0.20.3) mistakenly assumes there is a paragraph open
when creating a table, which is wrong if the table is a direct child of a
fo:flow or static content. A workaround is to enclose the table in a
fo:block.

creator: j3322ptm@yahoo.de
text: *** Bug 5552 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

creator: gadams@apache.org
text: move to normal priority, pending further action
MIF output format is no longer maintained
creator: gadams@apache.org

text: batch transition resolved+wontfix to closed+wontfix; if you believe this remains a bug and can demonstrate it with appropriate input FO file and output PDF file (as applicable), then you may reopen
creator: gadams@apache.org
